title: image-magick: unsatisfiable version constraint
body:
---

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack spec image-magick

Input spec
--------------------------------
image-magick

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: An unsatisfiable version constraint has been detected for spec:

    python@2.7.15%gcc@7.4.0+dbm~optimizations+pic+pythoncmd+shared~tk~ucs4 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^bzip2@1.0.6%gcc@7.4.0+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^diffutils@3.7%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^gdbm@1.18.1%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^readline@7.0%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
                ^ncurses@6.1%gcc@7.4.0~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
                    ^pkgconf@1.5.4%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^openssl@1.1.1%gcc@7.4.0+systemcerts arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^perl@5.26.2%gcc@7.4.0+cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@7.4.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^sqlite@3.26.0%gcc@7.4.0~functions arch=linux-centos7-x86_64


while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    meson@0.46.0:


meson requires python version 3:, but spec asked for 2.7.15

```

Building `meson` with `^python@3.7.2` works. How are python version clashes of deps handled by default? Is there really user action required to build `image-magick`? Would be great if `spack` could resolve this by default.
